noun.description: The basic monetary unit of Ecuador until 2000, equal to 100 centavos.

proper noun.description: The judicial capital and seat of the judiciary of Bolivia; population 274,576 (2009). Located in the Andes, at an altitude of 8,860 feet (2,700 m), it was named Chuquisaca by the Spanish in 1539. It was renamed in 1825 in honor of Antonio José de Sucre.

origin: Named after A. J. de Sucre (see Sucre, Antonio José de).
